contentrichtext.text: The '''Westminster Larger Catechism''', along with the [[Westminster Shorter Catechism]], is a central [[catechism]] of [[Calvinism|Calvinists]] in the [[England|English]] tradition throughout the world. == History == In 1643 when the [[Long Parliament]] of England called the [[Westminster Assembly]] to produce the [[Westminster Confession]], it also asked for a directory of "catechising". The Assembly asked [[Herbert Palmer (Puritan)|Herbert Palmer]] to produce a draft of the Larger Catechism. [[Robert Baillie]] and other [[Scotland|Scottish]] delegates found the work disappointing. In December 1643 a committee was formed to write the Catechism. In January 1647 the [[Westminster Assembly|Assembly]] gave up writing one [[catechism]] and split it into two. The [[Westminster Shorter Catechism]] was to be "easier to read and concise for beginners" and the Larger Catechism was to be "more exact and comprehensive". The Catechism was completed by the [[Westminster Assembly]] in 1647. It was then adopted by the General Assembly of the [[Church of Scotland]] in 1648 and (with modifications relating to the civil magistrate) by the [[Presbyterian]] Synod of [[New York]] and [[Philadelphia]] in 1788. ==See also== * [[Westminster Shorter Catechism]] == References == * Van Dixhorn, Chad [http://www.opc.org/new_horizons/NH00/0010b.html Is the Larger Catechism Worthwhile?] * [[William Maxwell Hetherington|Hetherington, William]] [http://www.reformed.org/books/hetherington/west_assembly/index.html ''History of the Westminster Assembly of Divines''] ==External links== * {{wikisource-inline|single=true}} * [http://www.reformed.org/documents/wlc_w_proofs/WLC_Intro.html Westminster Larger Catechism with Scripture proofs] [[Category:Westminster Standards]] [[Category:Catechisms]] [[Category:Congregationalism]] [[Category:Presbyterianism]] [[Category:English Reformation]] [[Category:Westminster Assembly]]
